member.name: IFolderFilter.GetEnumFlags
member.summary: Allows a client to specify which classes of objects in a Shell folder should be enumerated. When used with , specifies the class or classes of items that should be shown in the dialog box tree view and which class or classes should not.
member.param: A pointer to the folder's interface.
A pointer to the host's window handle.
One or more values that specify the classes of object to enumerate.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IFolderFilter.ShouldShow
member.summary: Specifies whether an individual item should be allowed through the filter and which should be blocked. When used with , specifies which items should be shown in the dialog box tree view and which should not. The determination to show or not show an item is up to the application.
member.param: A pointer to the folder's interface.
The relative PIDL of the child item of pidlFolder in question.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the item should be shown, S_FALSE if it should not be shown, or a standard error code if an error is encountered. If an error is encountered, the item is not shown.

member.name: IFolderFilter
member.summary: Exposed by a client to specify how to filter the enumeration of a Shell folder by a server application.
